DataElement.preferredName: Erythrocyte Transfusion Blood Bank Administered Unit Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric value quantifying stored containers of blood cells specialized for oxygen transport infused into an individual from donated blood products from a facility that collects and stores blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the infusion of blood cells specialized for oxygen transport given to an individual from donated blood products from a facility that collects, processes, and stores blood for transfusion..

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Red blood cells. Mature erythrocytes are non-nucleated, biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.:(trans-FYOO-zhun) The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed.

Concepts.definition: A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.

(trans-FYOO-zhun) The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed.

Property.preferredDefinition: An establishment (a separate free-standing facility or part of a larger institution) that collects, tests, processes, and stores blood and its components intended for transfusion or for further manufacture into products used for biological therapies.:Given.

Concepts.definition: An establishment that collects, tests, processes, and stores blood and its components intended for transfusion or for further manufacture into products used for biological therapies.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value quantifying stored containers of fluid or blood product for infusion into an individual at time of need.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.
Determining the number or amount of something.

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
